meanings.definition: The quality of being easily bent or flexed.
meanings.sent1: The pliantnesses of the rubber band allowed it to stretch without breaking.
meanings.sent2: I was impressed by the pliantnesses of the yoga instructor as she effortlessly moved from one pose to another.
meanings.sent3: The pliantnesses of the spaghetti made it a fun challenge to eat without making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her mind showed the pliantnesses of a young tree, ready to grow in any direction.
meanings.sent5: The pliantnesses of the clay made it easy for the sculptor to create intricate details.

meanings.definition: The state of being adaptable or easily influenced.
meanings.sent1: His pliantnesses in accepting new ideas made him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent2: The pliantnesses of the student's schedule allowed for last-minute changes without stress.
meanings.sent3: The pliantnesses of the puppy's behavior made training a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her pliantnesses in negotiations made her a successful businesswoman.
meanings.sent5: The pliantnesses of the organization's policies ensured smooth transitions during changes.

meanings.definition: The ability to be molded or shaped.
meanings.sent1: The potter admired the pliantnesses of the clay as it took the form of a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The pliantnesses of the child's mind allowed for easy learning of new skills.
meanings.sent3: The pliantnesses of the fabric made it perfect for creating intricate designs.
meanings.sent4: His pliantnesses under pressure made him a great candidate for leadership roles.
meanings.sent5: The pliantnesses of the material made it ideal for crafting delicate jewelry.
